title: Prefix Maximum Invariance
statementHtml:
Given two arrays xx and yy both of size mm, let zz be another array of size mm such that the prefix maximum at each position of zz is the same as the prefix maximum at each position of xx. Formally, max(x1,x2,…,xi)=max(z1,z2,…,zi)max⁡(x1,x2,…,xi)=max⁡(z1,z2,…,zi) should hold for all 1≤i≤m1≤i≤m. Define f(x,y)f(x,y) to be the maximum number of positions where zi=yizi=yi over all possible arrays zz.

You are given two sequences of integers aa and bb, both of size nn. Please find the value of ∑nl=1∑nr=lf([al,al+1,…,ar],[bl,bl+1,…,br])∑l=1n∑r=lnf([al,al+1,…,ar],[bl,bl+1,…,br]).
inputSpecHtml:
Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases tt (1≤t≤1041≤t≤104). The description of the test cases follows.

The first line of each test case contains an integer nn (1≤n≤2⋅1051≤n≤2⋅105).

The second line contains nn integers a1,a2,…,ana1,a2,…,an (1≤ai≤2⋅n)(1≤ai≤2⋅n).

The third line contains nn integers b1,b2,…,bnb1,b2,…,bn (1≤bi≤2⋅n)(1≤bi≤2⋅n).

It is guaranteed that the sum of nn over all test cases does not exceed 2⋅1052⋅105.
outputSpecHtml: For each test case, output the sum of f([al,al+1,…,ar],[bl,bl+1,…,br])f([al,al+1,…,ar],[bl,bl+1,…,br]) over all pairs of (l,r)(l,r).
noteHtml:
In the first test case, the answer is the sum of the following:

  • f([5],[4])=0f([5],[4])=0, using z=[5]z=[5].
  • f([3],[2])=0f([3],[2])=0, using z=[3]z=[3].
  • f([1],[1])=1f([1],[1])=1, using z=[1]z=[1].
  • f([5,3],[4,2])=1f([5,3],[4,2])=1, using z=[5,2]z=[5,2].
  • f([3,1],[2,1])=1f([3,1],[2,1])=1, using z=[3,1]z=[3,1].
  • f([5,3,1],[4,2,1])=2f([5,3,1],[4,2,1])=2, using z=[5,2,1]z=[5,2,1].
